intro: Naegelia, commonly known as the "ice plant," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Aizoaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and coastal environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Naegelia species are known for their ability to store water in their thick, fleshy leaves. They are popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to their low maintenance and aesthetic appeal.
